title: Bootstrap Images
subject: Bootstrap
theory:
## Handling Media
Images in HTML default to their native resolution, which can break layouts. Bootstrap fixes this.

### Responsive Images
`.img-fluid`: Applies `max-width: 100%; height: auto;`. The image scales with the parent width but never exceeds its original size.

### Shapes
* `.rounded`: Rounded corners (4px).
* `.rounded-circle`: Perfect circle (Avatar style).
* `.img-thumbnail`: 1px border with padding.

common_mistakes.correction: Without it, a large image will overflow its container on mobile screens, causing horizontal scrollbars.

exam_notes: img-fluid is mandatory for RWD (Responsive Web Design).
d-block mx-auto to center images (since they are inline-block by default).
summary: Images are tamed with `img-fluid` to ensure they fit correctly in any grid column.
